verses.roman:
vanaṁ kusumitaṁ śrīman
nadac-citra-mṛga-dvijam
gāyan mayūra-bhramaraṁ
kūjat-kokila-sārasam

synonyms: vanam—the forest; kusumitam—full of flowers; śrīmat—very beautiful; nadat—making sounds; citra—variegated; mṛga—animals; dvijam—and birds; gāyan—singing; mayūra—peacocks; bhramaram—and bees; kūjat—cooing; kokila—cuckoos; sārasam—and cranes.
translation: Flowers beautifully decorated the forest of Vṛndāvana, and many varieties of animals and birds filled it with sound. The peacocks and bees sang, and the cuckoos and cranes cooed.
